pull.title: test: Explain why test logging should be used
pull.body: Background is that some tests don't have any `self.log` call at all. Thus there are no "anchor points" and those tests are hard to debug because the logs can't easily be parsed by a human.

events.body: Yes, I have a list of tests I wanted to add logging to, but I was not sure that kind of change was desired. I ended up closing my last PR like that (#17535) due to lack of interest. Maybe one PR that adds all the missing logging would be helpful.
Looks like #17535 changed the release notes, refactored the test, and added logging. It seems a bit too much for one pull.
ACK. Looked at the changes on the PR branch. Good additions and :+1:  to no longer refer to travis.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -145,7 +145,7 @@ levels using the logger included in the test_framework, e.g.
   `test_framework.log` and no logs are output to the console.
 - when run directly, *all* logs are written to `test_framework.log` and INFO
   level and above are output to the console.
-- when run on Travis, no logs are output to the console. However, if a test
+- when run [on ci](/ci/README.md), no logs are output to the console. However, if a test

@@ -51,10 +51,13 @@ don't have test cases for.
 
 #### General test-writing advice
 
+- Instead of inline comments or no test documentation at all, prefer to log the comments to the test log. E.g.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -51,10 +51,13 @@ don't have test cases for.
 
 #### General test-writing advice
 
+- Instead of inline comments or no test documentation at all, prefer to log the comments to the test log. E.g.
+  `self.log.info('Creating enough transactions to fill a block'`. Logs make the test code easier to read and the test
comments.body: According to [review feedback](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17327#pullrequestreview-310002880), it may be better (and shorter) to use the indicative, e.g. "Create..." rather than "Creating..."

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -51,10 +51,13 @@ don't have test cases for.
 
 #### General test-writing advice
 
+- Instead of inline comments or no test documentation at all, prefer to log the comments to the test log. E.g.
+  `self.log.info('Creating enough transactions to fill a block'`. Logs make the test code easier to read and the test
comments.body:
(That comment proposes some good guidelines for your consideration:)
- "test x" rather than "testing x"
- logs can replace docstrings/comment blocks
- no need for trailing '...' ellipses
